result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darreck R. Borden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Darreck R. Borden in court with attorney Colleen Bradley.  Defendant Darreck R. Borden in custody (Winnebago County Jail).  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss and read-in to 15CF543.

Attorney Colleen Bradley in court, defendant Darreck R. Borden not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Ann Stauber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense will be attempting consolidation into Branch 4.   Court removes jury trial and bond continues.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Darreck R. Borden in court with attorney Colleen Bradley.  Defendant Darreck R. Borden in custody.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:15 am.
